summary: The "Rights for the Transportation Security Administration Workforce Act" aims to improve the rights and benefits of Transportation Security Administration (TSA) employees. It mandates applying the personnel system under Title 5 of the United States Code (governing federal employees) to TSA employees, eventually replacing the existing TSA personnel management system. The bill addresses pay, retirement, collective bargaining, and grievance processes, safeguarding employee rights during the transition. It also includes provisions for consultations, reports, and Comptroller General reviews related to recruitment, implementation, and workforce issues.
